label: 鏑矢
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: This type of arrow has a turnip-shaped bulb of horn or wood below the arrowhead, into which holes are drilled. When shot from a bow, the air passes through the holes making a large sound. Such arrows were used for rituals or as warning signals at the initiation of battle.
